name: prius_chaser
text: I'm glad somebody has finally summed up the feeling I get when I see the moonwalk.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, lamboyster, 7th_shot, TonyHighwind, Sweetlips, morbo)

name: tekende
text:
I read that for a second as "a flock of penguins flies over" and I was like "penguins can't fly, idiot."

Sorry for mistakenly thinking you were an idiot for a minute.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, tekende, Rhadamanthus, lastpolarbear, riotdejaneiro, mattbeetee, 7th_shot, Gompo, TonyHighwind, rascaldom, 762, mustconcentrate, aHatOfPig, logic, Doc_Rostov, Mirzabah, killingthejay)

name: tekende
text: That response was completely necessary. It also makes me feel like my initial reaction was, in fact, correct, though not for the reason assumed in the beginning.

name: soticoto
text:
Aye. I do things in a way you just don't dig.
You do things in a way I don't dig either.
But you got some posts that are decent from time to time, to my eyes.
And I never said anything about flying penguins, so I guess we're fine.

name: yople8
text:
I read that for a second as "mistakening you for an idiot".

That would have been awesome.

name: nabeel84
text: Excuse me, the moonwalk is fun for everyone.

name: tekende
text: In high school, I won two dance contests by doing the moonwalk. Everyone was just so excited about seeing me moonwalk. I have no idea why, but there it was.

name: huber
text: how good is Ray's face in the fourth panel

name: hollis
text: Almost as good as that retort.  "I'll just sit here being straight, and they'll be wrong."  Awesome.

name: spinynorman
text: I feel like it should be followed with a smooth hand motion that ends in a snap

name: foetus_punch
text:
I've actually used this in a conversation. Several times.

"Dude, did you just kiss another man that is pretty gay."
"Whatever, if somebody wants to call me gay, I'll just sit here being straight, and they'll be wrong."

name: perilon
text: This is without a doubt the most effective way to shut down someone's stupid reasoning about whether someone who is straight is actually gay.   I too say this.

name: cracker
text:
Exactly! For example:

"Dude, did you just pay another man to have sex with you? I've gotta say, that is pretty gay."
"Whatever, if somebody wants to call me gay, I'll just sit here being straight, and they'll be wrong."

name: zaratustra
text: wait wait. Sit where ?

name: foetus_punch
text: On a boner, obviously . Sheesh. The nerve on this guy.

name: quinlaenar
text: I just chubbied a man named foetus_punch. I have mixed feelings about this... A mixture of kickass and awesome.

name: greenkoolayd
text: hes confident and secure enough in his heterosexuality, that he doesnt care what people would potentially say.  i admire that.

name: rowboat
text: fag

name: greenkoolayd
text:
he told me its only gay to give head.


wait... ive used that terrible joke before on a different days comic [[sigh]]

name: rowboat
text: You talkin' Mexican Rules?

name: greenkoolayd
text: mexican rules=oxymoron.  brown guys never fight fair.

name: luckypyjamas
text: SO good

name: digdugz
text: I think I might go build a building.

name: mortshire
text: ray has figured out the perfect mindset for a straight dude to watch porn in.

name: mortshire
text:
^gay porn, i mean

*shame*

name: william
text: I'm not sure I can even fathom being straighter than John Wayne voting for Reagan on a horse.  That may actually be straighter than heterosexual intercourse.  Amazing.

name: fermatprime
text: Every time I read this strip I wish I were straight, just so I could use that line.

name: selbencoirlo
text: Heterosexual intercourse is actually kind of gay.

name: dougthehead
text: Depends on what you mean by "Reagan on a horse."

name: retardo
text: A comment left by retardo was marked as spam and excluded. retardo: What a douche. (reported by zaratustra, Patware, mrn)

name: delzhand
text: Your comment streak is unbelievable.  You're like a caricature of a gay man, instead of an actual person.  Funny thing is, the terrible image quality of your avatar bothers me more than your actual posts.

name: epicurus
text: Retardo's comment there was so incrdibly bad I think I aged like ten years when I read and understood it.

name: hollis
text: I retracted a comment I had made teasing Retardo about his crush on Onstad, as I do believe the guy wants to have a (semi)serious discussion about homosexuality and its role in American culture, or somesuch, but honestly Retardo... take the hint that this is not the best forum in which to discuss this.

name: retardo
text: A comment left by retardo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, Norsef, daidai, SSDDR, goocifer, Qeramah, whoper, equinn2006, L_C_B, Setzkin, midgetron, nutmeg, smilebuddha, Doc_Rostov, aperson, SotiCoto)

name: gompo
text: I'd say posting comments about how Onstad secretly wants to draw his characters getting it on is basically the definition of being a scary fan.

name: spinynorman
text: It's sort of hilarious, I have never once read a full comment by retardo, but I've seen his name everywhere. He's sort of like Morpheus from the first Matrix movie, except not as mysterious and probably not as cool of a dresser and while I bet he can rock a can or two better than Morpheus he probably can't handle the dual-wield machine gun pistol action.

name: greenkoolayd
text: A comment left by greenkoolayd was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, TheGreatestCape, JBrd328)

name: semiquaver
text: No, it's not.  Angelina Jolie is a highly exposed actress, and even so, mailing comparable to her would likely get you in trouble with the law.  Onstad is a relatively private author.  The fact that you spam every vaguely gay-related strip with love letters is creepy, and awful, and yes...scary.

name: semiquaver
text: "Mailing comparable notes to her"

name: johnnyrocker
text:
She is an actress and a UN goodwill ambassador.
Also she is a gold-dripping, half-lizard sex demon.

name: budenhagen
text:
Angelina Jolie is gross. Her body's hot and all but it looks like she got stung on the lips by a hive of bees.

... Though I guess there are ways to avoid looking at her face altogether which kinda makes my arguement void.

name: all-star951
text:
Oh! Here is someone who agrees with me about Angelina Jolie! High five.

Really, though, I've never paid attention to her body but her face is not pretty at all. I would not say ugly but she would get about a 3 out of ten for me.

name: lucid
text:
There are guys who understand the concept of the paper bag joke, and yet do not really find it amusing, as they find a woman's face an important part of the whole package.

These men do not tend to find Angelina Jolie a perfect package, a beauty without equal.

But damn, sometimes... There is definitely a lot going on with that woman.

name: omegatron
text:
[IMGS OFF]

Plastic surgery is a hell of a drug.

name: belgand
text: Oh great, now my dick's fallen off.

name: mangtastic
text: I want to give this asset a chubby for the plastic surgery comment, but the image has given me the exact opposite of a chubby.  I can't chubby this sir, not in good conscience.

name: pie4me6
text: What the hell man! *shudders*

name: envika
text: retardo is the chucklebot of this forum. except not hilarious.

name: envika
text: at least not here.

name: bjorntd
text: He's pushing some harsh chuckles these days.

name: tekende
text: And he's not usually in my room at night.

name: aelindil
text: Usually.

name: catachresis
text: Panels 4 and 5 have some of the best dialogue in all of Achewood

name: lawdog
text: Note too Ray's "boner guard" leg cross... just in case.

name: dwodles
text: Oh wow. I think that detail just made this one of my favorite strips.

name: chelloveck
text: That forth panel is sublime

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Upon further reflection, maybe this is the first Achewood I saw. It certainly is the first one that made a huge impression on me.

name: mountaindewtab
text: i'll just sit here bein straight and they'll be wrong

name: buttermoths
text: This is most definitely my all-time favorite story arc.

name: buttermoths
text: Although I appear to be neutral to it. How very curious.

name: dak
text: How many punchlines?

name: professoryes
text: So Many Punchlines.

name: buttermoths
text: More punchlines than there are ever being.

name: c_dizzle
text: hell of such as punchlines.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
While he may be somewhat abrasive at times, Ray is such a good friend for Beef.
I can only imagine how Beef would have reacted if he had opened up the Braveheart case instead.
All magnified shame sequences.
Molly all storming into the room and indignant, "Well, I certainly can't have any of this ! I'm leaving!"
Philippe all peeking in the window crying a solitary tear.

name: paco
text: This comic explained to me the way in which a man can behave in a completely gay fashion and somehow come out in a even more straight way than a raging homophobe. Thankyou, Onstad!

name: saru
text:
I really honestly can't help but think that this is Onstad's veiled rebuke of retardo.
"He can say I'm gay. I'll just sit here bein' straight, and he'll be wrong."

name: rhino
text: John Wayne was a fag.  I installed two-way mirrors in his pad in Brentwood, and he come to the door in a dress.

name: firesign
text: ...You probably should've lied about your age on here then, cause John Wayne died a decade before you were born. Just sayin'...

name: fineoakstructure
text: ...You should probably watch "Repo Man."  Just sayin'...

name: spicyponyhead
text: Dammit, I meant to lame this, and chubby the Repo Man reference!

name: mystkmanat
text: Upon examining other comments, it appears that you were referencing a movie which I have not seen.  I am sorry I lamed you.  It is only because I thought you were hating on John Wayne for no apparent reason.  Group hug?

name: drago25
text: That John Wayne line completely fills my heart with glee.

name: fosters
text: For a while when I read this strip I thought Ray was referring to the actual "man first walks on the moon" moonwalk. His description still kind of fit.

name: heccibiggs
text: I thought exactly the same thing. It was only when I read the comments that I got it.

name: mulisha7
text: I know it's cliched as hell to say, but this is my absolute favorite strip. Everything said in those last three panels is fried gold.

name: invidious
text:
Q: Is there a way to make this strip more awesome?
A: No, there is not.

name: atticusonline
text: This is Onstad's subtle response to Retardo's many accusations of him being gay.

name: nicejames
text: I don't think I'd ever read an achewood strip and give it anything but "pro", but man I love this particular one as well as the entire thread that follows.  Ray's superpower of turning any new discovery into a money-making scheme is inspiring.

name: tekende
text: I used to hang out at this gay bar a lot because I had a lot of gay friends. And they had TVs set up in the bar which sometimes showed music videos but more often than not played gay porn movies. I don't know if the whole genre of gay porn is like that stuff, but it was nasty. Not because it was two dudes doing the huckle buckle, but because the dudes would, like, lick each other's armpit hair and stuff. I was like, who the hell does that? Is this a thing of gay people? Because as much of a crush as I have on Fiona Apple, I would not like to lick her armpit hair.

name: atticusonline
text: Fiona Apple? Come now Tekende....

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i was suggested to listen to 'sleep to dream' as a dis by some kid i knew once.

i do not know him anymore.

name: libelandslander
text: Oh man. Panel 4. I really shouldn't be reading Achewood in class.
